I'm happy to help you find a new tennis court to play at! However, I'm a large language model, I don't have personal experiences or location-specific knowledge, so I won't be able to recommend specific courts in your city. But I can suggest some ways for you to find a court that suits your needs.

1. Online Search: You can try searching online for "tennis courts near me" or "tennis courts in [your city]" to find courts in your area. You can also check websites like Google Maps or Yelp to read reviews and find courts with good ratings.
2. Local Parks and Recreation Department: Contact your local parks and recreation department to ask about public tennis courts in your area. They may have a list of courts, including their location, availability, and fees.
3. Tennis Clubs and Facilities: Look for private tennis clubs or facilities in your area that offer court rentals or membership options. These may offer better amenities and more playing opportunities.
4. Ask Around: Ask friends, family, or coworkers if they know of any good tennis courts in the area. They may have personal recommendations or know of courts that are not well-advertised.

Regarding your charity basketball tournament, that sounds like a lot of fun! It's great that you were able to participate and support a good cause. If you're looking for more sports-related activities or tournaments, you might consider searching online for local sports leagues or organizations in your area.

I hope this helps, and happy tennis playing!
